metadata.title: CVE-2018-20184 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20181209 Q8, there is a heap-based bufferoverflow in the WriteTGAImage function of tga.c, which allows attackers tocause a denial of service via a crafted image file, because the number ofrows or columns can exceed the pixel-dimension restrictions of the TGAspecification.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm2
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm2
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm2
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm2
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.6+esm2').
